title: Point Style Of GGplot — formatPointsOfGGplot
text: plot (ggplot) data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). pointStyle (list) named list style definitions, output plotPointsServer ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat.

what: Server function for plot export — plotExportServer
title: Server function for plot export — plotExportServer
text: Backend plot export module

title: Server function for plot export — plotExportServer
code: plotExportServer(   id,   plotFun,   plotType = c("none", "ggplot", "ggplot_only_titles"),   filename = sprintf("%s_plot", gsub("-", "", Sys.Date())),   plotly = FALSE,   plotWidth = reactive(1280),   plotHeight = reactive(800),   initText = NULL,   initRanges = NULL )

title: Server function for plot export — plotExportServer
text: id namespace id plotFun (reactive) reactive function returning plot export plotType (character) one "none", "ggplot", "ggplot_only_titles". Adds option format titles ranges plot within export UI (currently ggplots). plotType == "ggplot_only_titles" titles can adjusted. prevents custom formatting axis ranges might overwritten formatRangesOfGGplot(). filename (character) name file without file extension plotly (logical) set TRUE plotFun returns plotly output plotWidth (reactive) default plot width plotHeight (reactive) default plot height initText (list) optional, named list title definitions, output plotTitlesServer initRanges (list) optional, named list range definitions, output plotRangesServer

title: Server function for plot points — plotPointsServer
text: id namespace id type (character) Type plot edit points , one "ggplot", "base". initStyle (list) optional, named list style definitions, format default output plotPointsServer hideInput (character) inputs disabled (hidden) applying module. Possible inputs "hide", "symbol", "color", "size", "alpha", "colorBg", "lineWidthBg". Please use shinyjs::useShinyjs() UI function enable feature.
